result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaine Ka Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Apply 16 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs ($243) - PAID IN FULL.  DNA surcharge is waived.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the victims/witnesses or their residences listed in the Criminal Complaint or the co-actors.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Restitution ($2,033.33) is to be paid joint/several with co-actors as follows:  $885 to Victim E. H. and $1,148.33 to American Family Insurance.  Cash bail applied.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) - all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - To be used at Agent's discretion.

Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kaine Ka Thomas in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presneted a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 3:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
16 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim/Witnesses or their residence listed in the criminal complaint or co-actors.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.


RESTITUTION:  $2,033.33 Joint/Several with Co-Actors (Breakdown:  $885 to Victim E.H. and $1,148.33 to American Family Insurance).
Costs:  $243
DNA Surchare:  Court Waives.
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
Bail to Be Apply to Costs and Surcharges First then to Restitution.
Balance of Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
STAYED.
To be used at agent's discretion.  



Count 4:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
16 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 3.

Apply Bail.


Count 5:

16 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation: 2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
